page.title: 01Polstead,physical features.
page.content: The area of the survey is only part of the large parish of Polstead,at one time one of the largest in Suffolk, covering about 4,000 acres,but,with the growth of nearby Boxford,the boundaries have been altered. The broad valley of the shallow river Box runs from north-west to south-east across the survey area. The land around is undulating with small rounded hills.Good hedges around the small fields,strips of woodland and small copses give the impression that the area is more wooded than it is.The narrow sunken winding lanes hide all but the immediate scene to the traveller . Polstead is composed of several hamlets,such as Whitestreet green and Mill street .The main centre of population is near the village green.
